revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 14:36:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add monasca_db command line tool

This commit adds a schema management tool for the Monasca
configuration database. Apart from the usual OpenStack schema
management tool subcommands (stamp, upgrade, version) it has
two extra subcommands:

* fingerprint: for computing a SHA1 fingerprint of the
               currently currently active database schema.
* detect-revision: for identifiying the Alembic revision
                   (if any) corresponding to a database
                   schema that was created with one of the
                   legacy SQL scripts.

The data provided by the detect-revision subcommand can be
used for stamping the database with Alembic version metadata
when transitioning an existing Monasca configuration database
to Alembic based database migrations.

Change-Id: Ibdd877a23ab5d6d1bbf8d83515c0197554098526
Story: 2001654
Task:  14341

commit_message:
Add monasca_db command line tool

This commit adds a schema management tool for the Monasca
configuration database. Apart from the usual OpenStack schema
management tool subcommands (stamp, upgrade, version) it has
two extra subcommands:

* fingerprint: for computing a SHA1 fingerprint of the
               currently currently active database schema.
* detect-revision: for identifiying the Alembic revision
                   (if any) corresponding to a database
                   schema that was created with one of the
                   legacy SQL scripts.

The data provided by the detect-revision subcommand can be
used for stamping the database with Alembic version metadata
when transitioning an existing Monasca configuration database
to Alembic based database migrations.

Story: 2001654
Task: 14341

Change-Id: Ibdd877a23ab5d6d1bbf8d83515c0197554098526

commit_message:
Move playbooks/config files into role examples

As we're removing this role from the integrated build in
https://review.openstack.org/587586 we should keep the
playbook and example configs in the role as we do for
other roles not integrated.

Change-Id: I937e429ef6ed673e750dd889d8d2034fd6ce463d

commit_message:
Follow-up patch to ramdisk interface

* Breaks up and updates a few tests
* Switches some checks to be capability based
* Add decoratores to ramdisk deploy interface
* Switches ramdisk deploy interface to use deploy_steps.

Change-Id: Ief730a8bd9750a9ed6828506c3642f4dd7246c46

subject: Fix numbered NIC mapping when using dotted VLAN notation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-07-27 10:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-27 19:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-30 09:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit e771e088c5eada6b9ab0ec5c32fec6fe98d25131'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 10:50:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix numbered NIC mapping when using dotted VLAN notation

When declaring VLANs using dotted notation (such as em1.10
for VLAN 10 on interface em1), numbered NICs are not
properly mapped to real interface names. This patch fixes
the handling of the mapped NIC names inside the BaseOpts
object that is the base class for all interface types.
This allows an interface name of "nic1.10" to be mapped
to, e.g. "em1.10"

Closes-bug: #1783206

Change-Id: Ibd9b28128900d9e959b82eb8673b8380bf20606a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix numbered NIC mapping when using dotted VLAN notation

When declaring VLANs using dotted notation (such as em1.10
for VLAN 10 on interface em1), numbered NICs are not
properly mapped to real interface names. This patch fixes
the handling of the mapped NIC names inside the BaseOpts
object that is the base class for all interface types.
This allows an interface name of "nic1.10" to be mapped
to, e.g. "em1.10"

Closes-bug: #1783206

Change-Id: Ibd9b28128900d9e959b82eb8673b8380bf20606a

commit_message:
Move zuul jobs in-repo

This moves the openstack-tox-py35 and openstack-tox-pep8 zuul jobs to be
defined in-repo.

Also, no need to run mnay of these jobs on patches that are only changing
documentation.

Change-Id: Ic211dabcc903dde8848c4f9be9ed9a3f8806c23a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix comments in _anchors_for_sharing_providers and related test

1. Remove "GROUP by" line in _anchors_for_sharing_providers, because
this has been removed in Ib1738fb4a4664aa7b78398655fd23159a54f5f69.
2. Add reminder note when we are sure all root_provider_id values are
NOT NULL.
3. Fix note in test_anchors_for_sharing_providers, s1 get r3 only via
agg3.

trivialfix

Change-Id: Id8bfd83db58366047267ff0eeb2930a19bddbf4e

commit_message:
[placement] Use oslotest CaptureOutput fixture

Instead of the nova fixture OutputStreamCapture. They do effectively
the same thing and once placement is extracted we'd like to not
have duplication.

blueprint: placement-extract

Given that the openstack_hosts role installs pip and virtualenv,
we do not need this extra meta-dependency.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:36:17.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8fa6589ac3b770e968edfbbfc18dc8e1c39573e1
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8fa6589ac3b770e968edfbbfc18dc8e1c39573e1

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-06-09 07:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 07:32:19.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I19fa4578d40b92f63947880f22163069a92e79c5
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I19fa4578d40b92f63947880f22163069a92e79c5

messages: [{'account_id': 28427, 'date': '2018-07-09 04:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 04:32:12.000000000', 'message': "Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: I0d09bc74b8d3c9ba4396ea4deb50feefe6142f23
"}]
commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: I0d09bc74b8d3c9ba4396ea4deb50feefe6142f23

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ieb432c391d3dcc798a30516ed96528a15f526d48
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 11:57:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ica0eb93b9b6703f9be57205eaae94cf9e2fb0268
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ica0eb93b9b6703f9be57205eaae94cf9e2fb0268

[{'created': '2018-07-30 14:28:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add systemd journal logging to the service config

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: I7bd5419e7f02593a16614746a974b5f8ab3aa504

commit_message:
Add systemd journal logging to the service config

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: I7bd5419e7f02593a16614746a974b5f8ab3aa504
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Make undercloud user-provided cert take precedence

The user-provided cert should take precedence over the user-provided
certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1755497

commit_message:
Deprecate xclarity hardware type

Lenovo Third Party CI is still being setup,
and while they are making forward progress,
we need to plan ahead for the Stein cycle.

As such, marking the xclarity hardware type
and related interfaces as deprecated.

Once Lenovo has their 3rd party CI operational,
this change can be reverted.

Change-Id: I3395063ce6a98e040518a133e7928f6c780f4829
Story: #2003097
Task: #23190

subject: Revert "Install virtualenv vor CentOS via distro packages"
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 08:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-08-01 08:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-08-01 08:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 08:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 12:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I8648dc3dd3ee04ac31a9497bf6a8c677374f1afc'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 08:36:43.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Install virtualenv vor CentOS via distro packages"

This reverts commit c0e35c572987d1e3f2f5afa2f798cafaeb6e4fe5.

Having virtualenv installed while also having pip_install active
is causing failures because pip is not there, and pip_install is
trying to install pip/setuptools/wheel and refuses. We need to
work out whether we can get rid of pip_install or some other
strategy.

Change-Id: Iff9772057554e146c0f0a3b4a7753cdd263853bc
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Install virtualenv vor CentOS via distro packages"

This reverts commit c0e35c572987d1e3f2f5afa2f798cafaeb6e4fe5.

Having virtualenv installed while also having pip_install active
is causing failures because pip is not there, and pip_install is
trying to install pip/setuptools/wheel and refuses. We need to
work out whether we can get rid of pip_install or some other
strategy.

Change-Id: Iff9772057554e146c0f0a3b4a7753cdd263853bc

subject: defaults: Add virtualenv to default pip packages
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-24 21:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 12:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I26046ab20cef0012a2d6c52c29827908f2d9f81c'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 15:34:16.000000000', 'message': "defaults: Add virtualenv to default pip packages

Right now, every os_* role explicitly requires and installs the
'virtualenv' package since they all deploy virtual environments for
the services. As we move towards using distribution packages as an
alternative, we can move this dependency to the pip_install role
so we can have a central place to reference the common PIP dependencies
across the hosts.

Change-Id: I4eb0a70dc6aa4437a6aa52caf510225c49ef8b11
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
defaults: Add virtualenv to default pip packages

Right now, every os_* role explicitly requires and installs the
'virtualenv' package since they all deploy virtual environments for
the services. As we move towards using distribution packages as an
alternative, we can move this dependency to the pip_install role
so we can have a central place to reference the common PIP dependencies
across the hosts.

Change-Id: I4eb0a70dc6aa4437a6aa52caf510225c49ef8b11
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in senlin

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows senlin to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I1b4c12ce16a6124a96053b8fd7a6fb20b75c9741

commit_message:
Add -Ss to curl executions

This commit makes sure curl is executed with --silent and --show-error
to get rid of progress bar and include errors in the output.

Change-Id: I9f1312a143beff067f6eec787784e5dd96dec485
Closes-Bug: 1784820

[{'created': '2018-07-11 15:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add placement.concurrent_udpate to generation pre-checks

We have two kinds of generation conflicts that happen (for both
resource providers and consumers). In
I5a164a0ee298846231113ad7b62b82a3e8f1f409 error codes are added for
conflicts that happen when incrementing the generation in the database.s

In this change the codes are added for those situations where in code we
are checking an incoming generation against the stored generation.

Since there are incoming genearations in this case, we can add tests
so this does, via gabbi.

Change-Id: I5ed005068c1c19194ed67556376604ae90727412
'}]
commit_message:
Add placement.concurrent_udpate to generation pre-checks

We have two kinds of generation conflicts that happen (for both
resource providers and consumers). In
I5a164a0ee298846231113ad7b62b82a3e8f1f409 error codes are added for
conflicts that happen when incrementing the generation in the database.s

In this change the codes are added for those situations where in code we
are checking an incoming generation against the stored generation.

Since there are incoming genearations in this case, we can add tests
so this does, via gabbi.

Change-Id: I5ed005068c1c19194ed67556376604ae90727412

commit_message:
Map instances to cell_v2 only once.

If nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell returns 2, it's because the cell already
exists and all instances are correctly mapped to the cell. The cell_v2
map_instances doesn't need to run.

Change-Id: I38002a18dff4dbd44bd3df9e1969c9d50ab12705
Related-Bug: 1729661
(cherry picked from commit 0f24bb8bd45e6c3c4f1dc0fed1418c6be79525ee)

commit_message:
Add non-voting rolling upgrade test

This patch implements a non-voting rolling upgrade test
using openstack-ansible tooling. The job and pipeline
is defined in-repo to ensure that the glance team has
complete control over the voting status, pipelines it is
in, etc.

The test uses the 'upgrade' tox environment in the
openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance repository which
executes a build of two glance containers using the
the head of the stable branch of glance, then upgrades
to the proposed review. The upgrade is a complete rolling
upgrade using MariaDB as a database and using the file
system store.

Change-Id: I9e92a154e58bb2f15cc056c43c9750bcdd38fdf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 14:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct pip install for upgrade test

When executing the upgrade test, the pip install for the
host was not executing the changes to place UCA on the
host, and as a result the libvirt-python package cannot
build.

Now we ensure that we use the previous pip install version
so that UCA is setup on the host.

Change-Id: I7904a1943fa92f98a20131d88f7a967b15a10254
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct pip install for upgrade test

When executing the upgrade test, the pip install for the
host was not executing the changes to place UCA on the
host, and as a result the libvirt-python package cannot
build.

Now we ensure that we use the previous pip install version
so that UCA is setup on the host.

Change-Id: I7904a1943fa92f98a20131d88f7a967b15a10254

commit_message:
Remove repo_requires_pip_packages and pip_install meta-dep

Given that the openstack_hosts role installs pip and virtualenv,
we do not need this extra meta-dependency and extra task/var.

Change-Id: Iac9f72586f6b26bd31d59a4fa5055687ff77f78b

why did the grenade fail? I wonder if we're going to start seeing intermittent issues with that already... :/"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-06-23 01:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-06-24 16:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> recheck
 > 
 > why did the grenade fail? I wonder if we're going to start seeing
 > intermittent issues with that already... :/

http://logs.openstack.org/88/576388/1/check/octavia-grenade/03e380c/logs/screen-o-hm.txt.gz#_Jun_19_08_16_00_675645

"WARNING octavia.controller.healthmanager.health_drivers.update_db [-] Amphora b1543928-1219-424e-9d6d-f3291a0546de health message was processed too slowly: 14.2308630943s! The system may be overloaded or otherwise malfunctioning. This heartbeat has been ignored and no update was made to the amphora health entry. THIS IS NOT GOOD."

I guess this is a valid case when services are restarted at upgrade. In case the job starts to fail often we could increase [health_manager]/heartbeat_interval_val from 10 (default) to a more reasonable value. Also, we could document this on our upgrading guide (WIP).'}, {'account_id': 25058, 'date': '2018-06-25 02:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add exception handling for housekeeping service

Capture exceptions for each thread's task handler to prevent it
from exiting abnormaly.
Story: 2001749
Task: 12128

Change-Id: I0fef53347e4460b8e6e200589736ae65c85a5145

[{'created': '2018-05-10 12:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Make parameter VhostuserSocketGroup is mandatory for OVS-DPDK roles

Without VhostuserSocketGroup configured as hugetlbfs (required by
nova-libvirt and neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent services), guest VMs
could not be created. Since the role-specific parameter merging
is not available, user has to override it, in their environment,
eventhough using the existing environment file. Adding this parameter
in the roles data file, makes it available always.

Change-Id: Id8d2b67a116e7458ce398466e2dd2f1e351605b7

commit_message:
Make VhostuserSocketGroup param as mandatory for ComputeOvsDpdkRT role

Without VhostuserSocketGroup configured as hugetlbfs (required by
nova-libvirt and neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent services), guest VMs
could not be created. Add this parameter to the roles data file.

Change-Id: Id8d2b67a116e7458ce398466e2dd2f1e351605b7

[{'account_id': 28847, 'date': '2018-08-01 09:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-01 09:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-08-01 09:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-08-01 09:53:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

The reason of issue is in the structure of variables in plugins.spec. Since
infrared converts varibles from plugin.spec to dict, there is some limitations
and following example won't work.

For example:

commit_message:
Fix issue with failed OOO upgrade

The reason of issue is in the structure of variables in plugins.spec. Since
infrared converts varibles from plugin.spec to dict, there is some limitations
and following example won't work.

For example:
  example-key: value
  example-key-foo: value1
  example-key-bar: value2

Change-Id: I50ca550d225e52ba44b76a70b1db1c34088b88d9

commit_message:
Fix issue with failed OOO upgrade

The reason of issue is in the structure of variables in plugins.spec. Since
infrared converts varibles from plugin.spec to dict, there is some limitations
and following example won't work.

For example:
  example-key: value
  example-key-foo: value1
  example-key-bar: value2

Change-Id: I50ca550d225e52ba44b76a70b1db1c34088b88d9

commit_message:
Services: Fix service connectivity after service port edit procedure

Kubernetes supports edit operation for API resources.
This patch updates LBaaS handler to add members as expected
to the new Pool after service port edit procedure.

Change-Id: I6d229c92f6de9b9827db7fec4a3765b634d1b57d
Closes-Bug: 1784683

(1 comment)

I think we need to add more actions to multi_vif driver to handle tasks like releasing/activation the VIF.  Presently these tasks are done by the vif handler. 
for example, if we wish to graciously handle partially failed add/release requests in the future, vif handler will become bloated due to multi-vif specific code.'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-06-25 16:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I think we need to add more actions to multi_vif driver to handle
 > tasks like releasing/activation the VIF.  Presently these tasks are
 > done by the vif handler.
 > for example, if we wish to graciously handle partially failed
 > add/release requests in the future, vif handler will become bloated
 > due to multi-vif specific code.

The idea is to utilize the MultiVIFPool mechanism. Currently, all kinds of VIF driver can be load by MultiVIFPool automatically. In multiple interfaces case, all VIFs create/delete can still follow the same procedure.'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-06-26 07:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:08:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-06-29 03:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 06:55:42.000000000', 'message': 'Implement multi-vif driver

This patch implements the multi-vif of VIF-Handler And Vif
Drivers Design.

This patch creates a new driver type MultiVIFDriver. It will
be the base class of real drivers like sriov,
additional_subnet and npwg_multiple_interfaces. Each of the
derived driver should implement the parsing of the additional
interfaces definition in K8S pods, and call VIF driver to
either create or acquire the Neutron port and its VIF object.

An list of enabled drivers can be returned by its class method.
So that, VIFHandler can invoke each driver one by one to get
the whole list of interfaces for one pod.

Change-Id: I8b5175a4637b18a0b574e27674a217865afb22b7
Signed-off-by: Peng Liu <pliu@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 05:13:03.000000000', 'message': 'Implement multi-vif driver

commit_message:
Implement multi-vif driver

This patch implements the multi-vif of VIF-Handler And Vif
Drivers Design.

This patch creates a new driver type MultiVIFDriver. It will
be the base class of real drivers like sriov,
additional_subnet and npwg_multiple_interfaces. Each of the
derived driver should implement the parsing of the additional
interfaces definition in K8S pods, and call VIF driver to
either create or acquire the Neutron port and its VIF object.

A list of enabled drivers can be returned by its class method.
So that the VIFHandler can invoke each driver one by one to
get the whole list of interfaces for one pod.

Partially Implements: blueprint multi-vif-pods
Change-Id: I8b5175a4637b18a0b574e27674a217865afb22b7
Signed-off-by: Peng Liu <pliu@redhat.com>

when was this changed and does it require a minimum bump as well?'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-31 08:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

also, -2 as this needs a FFE to the dev list first (prefix with [FFE][requirements]'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-07-31 08:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The name of this package was changed around 2 years ago, but nobody noticed it here, because the tox env "pip-install" is not executed by Zuul.'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-07-31 09:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:03:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

configparser is part of the standard library, and was renamed between Python 2 and Python 3. We recently updated all of the jobs to run under python 3 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578943/. The pip-install environment is affected because that patch changes the testenv default settings, and we didn't catch the problem in the gate because we do not run a job that uses that virtualenv in the gate."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ok, so this was blocking the infra job then?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> ok, so this was blocking the infra job then?

I don't think we use that environment for any jobs in CI. I'm not sure what it's for."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 01:35:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> > ok, so this was blocking the infra job then?
 > 
 > I don't think we use that environment for any jobs in CI. I'm not
 > sure what it's for.

It was added in Ibc37593afcc4d9f820cb88168e1aa15e773b2087 with the intent of making a voting job that called it.  IT was in response to several of our tools using libraries that weren't listed in requirements.txt (but were in test-requirements.txt).

I know that we're frozen but IMO that really is with the aim of stabilising the OpenStack release.  this change has no impact on that goal, and fixes a clear, albeit small, issue."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 01:46:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also this is run when you run a bare 'tox' in openstack/requirements

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/tox.ini#n4"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

do we still intend this to be run on py27?  does this code change run correctly on py27?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> do we still intend this to be run on py27?  does this code change
 > run correctly on py27?

Not really.  We can pick which python version we want it to run under.  I s'pose we could introduce incompatibilities and/or fail to notice a regression by only running it under a single python version but I'm okay with accepting that risk.  Esp. given we don't actually run it in the gate anyway."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:49:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

couldn't we set basepython staticly for the job?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 02:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-01 03:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

even better :D'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-01 03:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-08-01 06:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks @Tony, I forgot here about six ;)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 06:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thanks @Tony, I forgot here about six ;)

np, six.moves ... fixing small amounts of py2 <-> py3 transitions pains ;P'}, {'account_id': 18551, 'date': '2018-08-01 07:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}]

commit_message:
Fixed "pip-install" test

The "pip-install" tox environment was failing, because the name
of the "ConfigParser" package was changed into "configparser".
This commit fixes that by using the six.moves module to do the right
thing on py2 and py3

Change-Id: I6b16c8f0e182850cda041ca294edc5ad04c1a3c3

commit_message:
Define common variables for irrelevant-files

We can define common variables for irrelevant-files
used across various dsvm and functional jobs and then
reference them using node anchors to avoid duplication.

Change-Id: Ife046b91c96dd300e8c46125b75623d8e12b8da3
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump ansible_version_min to 2.4

the include_tasks is the new feature in version 2.4[0], and
kolla use it[1], the ansible_version_min should be updated
to version 2.4

[0]: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_tasks_module.html
[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584728/

Change-Id: I273ac9e8295bfe3fb97af620c1e48e9fbbf06c6e

[{'created': '2018-05-07 06:01:31.000000000', 'message': 'Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback

We seem to leave replaced_by field of a resource after rollback
(if a stack cancel is issued before the replacement
resource is added to the stack). This in turn results in the
stack getting stuck in IN_PROGRESS for further updates.

Change-Id: I3361ad90e303d24a16a943408fe0f6c406cf785f
Task: #19582
Story: #2001974
'}, {'created': '2018-05-11 09:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback

We seem to leave replaced_by field of a resource after rollback
(if a stack cancel is issued before the replacement
resource is added to the stack). This in turn results in the
stack getting stuck in IN_PROGRESS for further updates.

Change-Id: I3361ad90e303d24a16a943408fe0f6c406cf785f
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Task: #19582
Story: #2001974
'}]
commit_message:
Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback

We seem to leave replaced_by field of a resource after rollback
(if a stack cancel is issued before the replacement
resource is added to the stack). This in turn results in the
stack getting stuck in IN_PROGRESS for further updates.

Change-Id: I3361ad90e303d24a16a943408fe0f6c406cf785f
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Task: #19582
Story: #2001974

subject: Deny quota creation for non-uuid projects
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2018-04-06 10:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-04-06 11:32:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think we should be doing such an API change that may break existing applications, even if their actions may not have the expected effect.

How about doing a patch to python-designateclient instead to normalize the project parameter to the UUID form before it is submitted?"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-04-06 17:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Yeah - we cannot break APIs like this.

Project IDs are not always UUID like (and in a few public clouds over the years were not.)

I will comment more on the bug, but we should have a better solution in the R or S cycle.

If this is wanted in the interim, we would need to make it a config item that defaults to off.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-06-18 17:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

alternative approach is being tried out here

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576219'}, {'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2018-08-01 08:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Alternative patch merged'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 10:14:06.000000000', 'message': 'Deny quota creation for non-uuid projects

Such projects are not actually used when applying quotas
and ability to set them just confuses users.

Ability to delete non-uuid quotas is left in place to
allow for their eventual removal

Change-Id: I8c074a0cac617e587a192ceadff16bef0aeb5b5b
Closes-Bug: #1760822
'}]
commit_message:
Deny quota creation for non-uuid projects

Such projects are not actually used when applying quotas
and ability to set them just confuses users.

Ability to delete non-uuid quotas is left in place to
allow for their eventual removal

Change-Id: I8c074a0cac617e587a192ceadff16bef0aeb5b5b
Closes-Bug: #1760822

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

lower bounds of individual python modules are declared to
(test-)requirements.txt as requirements-check requires.

To work with neutron-lib 1.18.0, we need Rocky version of neutron,
so the minimum version of neutron is bumped to 13.0.0.0b2 (Rocky-2).

We also need to bump the minimum version of SQLAlchemy. Rocky neutron
depends on pending_to_persistent ORM event in SQLAlchemy which was added
in SQLAlchemy 1.1. Rocky neutron now requires SqlAlchemy>=1.2.0,
so the min version of SQLAlchemy is bumped to 1.2.0.

To fix tempest tests, we also disable port security. As current tests
already run with a wildcard security group to allow all traffic,
switching to port security disabled does not change much

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bernard Cafarelli <bcafarel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie83ab14ae74d1f4c35876f1d0d5ca3106b4cd12e
Closes-Bug: #1783997

commit_message:
Map instances to cell_v2 only once.

If nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell returns 2, it's because the cell already
exists and all instances are correctly mapped to the cell. The cell_v2
map_instances doesn't need to run.

Change-Id: I38002a18dff4dbd44bd3df9e1969c9d50ab12705
Related-Bug: 1729661
(cherry picked from commit 0f24bb8bd45e6c3c4f1dc0fed1418c6be79525ee)

commit_message:
Move handler flush to after MQ setup

In order to run 'designate-manage pool update' from
designate_db_setup.yml the MQ services need to already
be prepped and the services need to be running.

Change-Id: Ie071996d5fcab0f8955db5dc23c41056f1ea53ae

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary MQ vhost/user creation tasks/vars

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test vars and tasks which were duplicated
as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I7209861cd0b285ce1d641f68d2e97505cd3b1fb8

Change-Id: I9e78c3d1263e140ac7b3afafe2a59da381c338e0
'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 08:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Enable more extensions into pep8

This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None.
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I9e78c3d1263e140ac7b3afafe2a59da381c338e0
'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 02:54:28.000000000', 'message': 'Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None.

commit_message:
Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None.
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I9e78c3d1263e140ac7b3afafe2a59da381c338e0

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

Change-Id: I1ded871fe9dc46b5a3eb48e453cd9d646af4aad7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 11:55:40.000000000', 'message': "Default MQ RPC/Notify credentials/vhosts to match

When the RPC and Notify service are the same, the credentials
must match - otherwise the tasks to create the user/password
will overwrite with each other.

If the two clusters are different, then the matching credentials
and vhost will not be a problem. However, if the deployer really
wishes to make sure they're different, then the vars can be
overridden.

Also, to ensure that the SSL value is consistently set in the
conf file, we apply the bool filter. We also use the 'notify'
SSL setting as the messaging system for Notifications is more
likely to remain rabbitmq in our default deployment with qrouterd
becoming the default for RPC messaging.

Change-Id: Id94e6337032807ee5baa79945e043c9282e17263

commit_message:
Default MQ RPC/Notify credentials/vhosts to match

When the RPC and Notify service are the same, the credentials
must match - otherwise the tasks to create the user/password
will overwrite with each other.

If the two clusters are different, then the matching credentials
and vhost will not be a problem. However, if the deployer really
wishes to make sure they're different, then the vars can be
overridden.

Also, to ensure that the SSL value is consistently set in the
conf file, we apply the bool filter. We also use the 'notify'
SSL setting as the messaging system for Notifications is more
likely to remain rabbitmq in our default deployment with qrouterd
becoming the default for RPC messaging.

Change-Id: Id94e6337032807ee5baa79945e043c9282e17263

- gate-swift-tox-func http://logs.openstack.org/40/185940/3/check/gate-swift-tox-func/93f89e6/ : SUCCESS in 5m 06s (non-voting)

- check-swift-dsvm-functional http://logs.openstack.org/40/185940/3/check/check-swift-dsvm-functional/203a608/ : SUCCESS in 17m 01s'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2015-05-28 14:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm wondering about this change. The original code looks indeed weird, but this one changes some internal behavior and thus is questionable - or am I missing something here?

I agree that there is room for improvement here, but there is hopefully another solution to the original code. What do you think Kota?"}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2015-05-29 07:19:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Christian

Thanks for reviewing. I agree we should not mangle the original path by hand *as possible*.

Current FakeSwift simulates simple key/value store. (i.e. it expects the path for PUT/GET is symmetric)

However, SLO behaves asymmetrically on the point of path like as:
- PUT /a/c/o?multipart-manifest=put
- GET /a/c/o?multipart-manifest=get

There is the path (strictly query args) difference and that requires weird path (i.e. GET /a/c/o?multipart-manifest=put) right now for GET after PUT in some unit tests.

As another plan to improve this, would parsing the original path to /a/c/o path and query string be better (but I'm not sure)?

i.e.
- FakeSwift would always save the path w/o query string in uploaded dict
- Add query string value into the last of tuple
- Add some emulation handling hook to FakeSwift GET path

e.g.
parsed_path = urllib2.urlparse.urlparse(path)
self.uploaded[parsed_path.path] = (headers, input, parsed_path.query)

# and then hook _get_response somewhere

I'm not sure because it will be bigger patch than this but seems better for maintainability."}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2015-05-29 07:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

wow, the example lines are broken to see. I rewrote them, here.

 parsed_path = urllib2.urlparse.urlparse(path) 

 self.uploaded[parsed_path.path] = (headers, input, parsed_path.query)

 # and then hook _get_response somewhere'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2015-06-26 08:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Still working'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-12 21:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 05:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-08-01 07:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
(POC) Add Zaqar publisher

Add Zaqar publisher for Searchlight, notification handlers
should pass extra projects they wish to be notified, zaqar
publisher will use project info to send resource doc to
corresponding queues.

Partially implements: blueprint notification-forwarding
Change-Id: Id2e9f970836fdaf19521b8c73318c332c8d708d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 16:16:55.000000000', 'message': "Collect logs: split and move the script creation

Since we create the collect logs script only at the end of the playbooks
run, when a job times out, there is no collect_logs.sh script created,
and the post-run playbook doesn't actually run anything.
This change split the function in two parts, the first part creates the
script, and its call is moved to before the playbooks run. The second
part is moved to toci_quickstart directly and runs after the playbooks.
The second part should not be needed anymore with zuulv3 in rdo
provider.

Change-Id: Iee897f780c93bdf847e188fc033e8be112e12a4f
"}, {'created': '2018-07-30 16:18:26.000000000', 'message': "Collect logs: split and move the script creation

commit_message:
Collect logs: split and move the script creation

Since we create the collect logs script only at the end of the playbooks
run, when a job times out, there is no collect_logs.sh script created,
and the post-run playbook doesn't actually run anything.
This change split the function in two parts, the first part creates the
script, and its call is moved to before the playbooks run. The second
part is moved to toci_quickstart directly and runs after the playbooks.
The second part should not be needed anymore with zuulv3 in rdo
provider.

Closes-Bug: #1784417
Change-Id: Iee897f780c93bdf847e188fc033e8be112e12a4f

commit_message:
Fix ssl warnings on tempest containerized

The python-tempestconf uses requests python module to make the calls to
the openstack api, if ssl is enabled, the requests throws an error
saying that cannot validate the certificate, and so fails. This only
happens when we run tempest containerized.
In order to avoid that, we are using PYTHONWARNINGS and CURL_CA_BUNDLE
environment variables to skip ssl check.

Change-Id: Id53643fecc545a2a15b8bab478dd49d32de4068c

commit_message:
[generate_puppetfile] Add support for handling commit

We sometimes [1] need to use a commit hash as a pin,
so adapt the script to work with commit hash pins as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586946/

Change-Id: I8867b3d41dc6ceef084c6d978cc405b9f6710375

If the backing FlexVol security style is configured

shares.

Change-Id: I12c85c54c7318592ac0b34efe3624d175d2e6976

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Fix security style for CIFS shares

If the backing FlexVol security style is configured
incorrectly, end users cannot write to their manila
shares.

Change-Id: I12c85c54c7318592ac0b34efe3624d175d2e6976
Closes-Bug: #1696000
(cherry picked from commit 5e8df296abcc2f08aac085b09aeae202508d5dc7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 14:12:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix getting share networks and security services error

It will fail when non-admin tenants try to get share networks
and security services with option '{all_tenants: 1}'.
The reason is that the policy of 'get_all_share_networks' and
'get_all_security_services' are admin api, they do not allow
the non-admin tenants list the share networks and security
services with all_tenants=1. This patch removes the policy check
of non-admin tenants and allows non-admin tenants to request to
list with 'all_tenants=1', however 'all_tenants' in the request
is just ignored.

Change-Id: Ied021b66333f1254cd232bbc38562a4a9b762ad2
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: #1721787
(cherry picked from commit 9f69258cab9baf77384282b67feb390d0487d3b9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix getting share networks and security services error

It will fail when non-admin tenants try to get share networks
and security services with option '{all_tenants: 1}'.
The reason is that the policy of 'get_all_share_networks' and
'get_all_security_services' are admin api, they do not allow
the non-admin tenants list the share networks and security
services with all_tenants=1. This patch removes the policy check
of non-admin tenants and allows non-admin tenants to request to
list with 'all_tenants=1', however 'all_tenants' in the request
is just ignored.

Change-Id: Ied021b66333f1254cd232bbc38562a4a9b762ad2
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: #1721787
(cherry picked from commit 9f69258cab9baf77384282b67feb390d0487d3b9)

commit_message:
Allow volume-transfer creation < 3.55 microversion

Handling for the new `no_snapshots` option was incorrectly handling
microversion evaluation that would prevent anything less than the new
microversion from working. This changes the check to only handle the
changed argument for 3.55 and later.

Change-Id: If96889ccde6044706e6a5dcd83fde3c20fe1c1fd
Closes-bug: #1784703
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

> Did you test this patch in real environment?
From log:http://logs.openstack.org/54/587354/2/check/watcher-tempest-functional/1208fc9/job-output.txt.gz

The error is :testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: u'ubuntu-xenial-rax-iad-0001084553' != None

commit_message:
Do not wait if volume status is error

If the volume has failed to be created and the status is error,
the progress will still wait until timeout which wastes time.

Change-Id: I869b5e6eaf731846594f6257b1a7b422b1b5a195

Write sphinxext debug tempfile with linebreaks

It's much easier to debug the output if it isn't all on one line.

Change-Id: I446036aa043b74bb0f39deedd3f2cb9d08fd4dce

Hi Zhaobo,

I tried to put together a unit test to check the StaleData error: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584730. It works fine. The only problem is that I don't get the StateData error. Wanted to share it with you, in case you find it helpful to understand what is going on. I based it loosely on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328185/5/neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py@6138"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:48:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Hi Zhaobo,

Regardless of the locking puzzle, don't we need code in neutron/db/l3 to check, when a port is being associated to a floating ip, that the fip doesn't have port forwardings. If it does, we should fail the port association, shouldn't we? Have you considered this in any of the patches?"}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-07-23 07:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

| I tried to put together a unit test to check the StaleData error: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584730. 
| It works fine. The only problem is that I don't get the StateData error. Wanted to share it with you, 
| in case you find it helpful to understand what is going on. I based it loosely on 
| https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328185/5/neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py@6138

Many thanks, Miguel. I'm looking and try to deep into it in a new env. Thanks. I'm sure you are trying to exclude
a possible doubtful point. :)

| Regardless of the locking puzzle, don't we need code in neutron/db/l3 to check, when a port is being associated
| to a floating ip, that the fip doesn't have port forwardings. If it does, we should fail the port association,
| shouldn't we? Have you considered this in any of the patches?

Yeah, that's the key point of this feature, if we make the association like 1:1 DNAT, the port have the whole right to
own the 1 to 65535 protocol ports, so we don't allow create port forwarding on that fip. We just allow a port could be
associated with a "Free" floatingip.
If a port is being associated to a floatingip, that the fip doesn't have port forwardings(we implement it as a callback
check when update/delete fip). If it is checked by the callback that there are some port forwarding associations,
the update/delete fip operation must be fail. (That means before associate fip like the previous way 1:1 DNAT, we must
make sure the fip is "Free", if not, users need to firstly delete the port forwarding which is the fip subresource.)

So the patch series I post are willing to implement like this, but the function of this part should be in the service plugin
part, contain the base service plugin patch and the fix the race condition patch. :)'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

[{'created': '2018-06-12 09:14:23.000000000', 'message': '[WIP][2] Neutron server side Floating IP port forwarding

This patch fixes some issues in race condiction, and adds another api
extension for exposing "port_forwardings" fields in the floatingip GET
request.

Notes: For neutron-lib releases, the spec[1] mentioned port forwarding
resources behavior may be a little different for default values. For
now, we support no default value cases, but the default value will be
done after server and agent side code done.

[1]
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/rocky/port-forwarding.html

'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 11:13:05.000000000', 'message': "[2] Neutron server side Floating IP port forwarding

This patch fixes some issues, such as port forwarding resource
conflict with floatingip resource and port forwarding resource
conflict with port resource.

As the port forwarding resource associated with 2 resources,
one is floatingip, the other is neutron internal port resource.
So floatingip update/delete maybe in a conflict situation with
port forwarding CUD. But for port, we just lack the logic to
process port forwarding during update port's fixed_ip and delete
port. So my approach is that serialization, as the key point here
we must to make sure the fip/port existing during create/update
port forwarding and also make sure whether there is a port forwrading
inused based on the fip during update/delete fip operation.

So in this patch:
* for fip race issue, I introduce 2 functions in that patch.
  _do_create_if_parallel lock by a external lock which based on
  its related fip_ip
  _check_floatingip_request lock by a external lock based on its
  floatingip id.
So during floatingip update/delete, these functions will be locked
to process serialize if they process the same fip resource in the
same time.

* for port, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will
delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the
fip protocol_port.

Notes: For neutron-lib releases, the spec[1] mentioned port forwarding
resources behavior may be a little different for default values. For
now, we support no default value cases, but the default value will be
done after server and agent side code done.

[1]
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/rocky/port-forwarding.html

Change-Id: I637ebcb33b91d899a077bded5ca10097a830a847
Partial-Bug: #1491317

to process serialize if they process the same fip resource in the
same time.

* for port, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will
delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the
fip protocol_port.

"}, {'created': '2018-07-23 03:49:26.000000000', 'message': "[server side] Fix race issue for port forwarding plugin

This patch fixes some issues, such as port forwarding resource
conflict with floatingip resource and port forwarding resource
conflict with port resource.

As the port forwarding resource associated with 2 resources,
one is floatingip, the other is neutron internal port resource.
So floatingip update/delete maybe in a conflict situation with
port forwarding creation. But for port, we just lack the logic to
process port forwarding during update port's fixed_ip and delete
port. So my approach is that serialization, as the key point here
we must to make sure the fip/port existing during create/update
port forwarding and also make sure whether there is a port forwarding
in use based on the fip during update/delete fip operation.

So in this patch:
* for fip race issue, I introduce 2 functions in that patch.
  _do_create_if_parallel lock by a external lock which based on
  its related fip_ip
  _check_floatingip_request lock by a external lock based on its
  floatingip id.
So during floatingip update/delete, these functions will be locked
to process serialize if they process the same fip resource in the
same time.

* for port, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will
delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the
fip protocol_port.

Notes: For neutron-lib releases, the spec[1] mentioned port forwarding
resources behavior may be a little different for default values. For
now, we support no default value cases, but the default value will be
done after server and agent side code done.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Change-Id: I637ebcb33b91d899a077bded5ca10097a830a847
Partial-Bug: #1491317

Partial-Bug: #1491317
"}, {'created': '2018-07-27 12:49:01.000000000', 'message': "[server side] Fix race issue for port forwarding plugin

This patch fixes the race condition with update/delete neutron
serveral resources, such as port forwarding conflict with
floatingip and port forwarding conflict with port.

As the port forwarding resource associated with 2 resources,
one is floatingip, the other is neutron internal port.
So floatingip update/delete maybe in a conflict situation with
port forwarding creation. But for port, we just lack the logic to
process port forwarding during update port's fixed_ip and delete
port.

So the approach here is adding logic to let l3 plugin and port
forwarding plugin know each other when both sides may process the same
floatingip resource. Based on the existing revision_number feature,
if one side fail as db staleError, the api layer will retry the whole
operation for this resource, so there must be a failure on one side in
this case. This patch just adds the association logic for l3 plugin and
port forwarding plugin, also adds a event receiver for port update/delete.

Then the behavior about the port forwarding associated resources would
be:
* For fip resource, I introduce one function in that patch.
  _check_floatingip_request
So during floatingip update/delete, the function will process
fip and check by rpc callback from l3_plugin, if port forwarding plugin
also creates a port forwarding with the same fip at this moment. The
success side would be the one who update the fip_db first, the other side
would be failure after db retry.

* For port resource, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will
delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the
fip:external_port socket.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Change-Id: I637ebcb33b91d899a077bded5ca10097a830a847
Partial-Bug: #1491317

commit_message:
[server side] Fix race issue for port forwarding plugin

This patch fixes the race condition with update/delete neutron
serveral resources, such as port forwarding conflict with
floatingip and port forwarding conflict with port.

Also this approach need the revision function, so need to fix in port
forwarding model to aware relationship revision update.

As the port forwarding resource associated with 2 resources,
one is floatingip, the other is neutron internal port.
So floatingip update/delete maybe in a conflict situation with
port forwarding creation. But for port, we just lack the logic to
process port forwarding during update port's fixed_ip and delete
port.

So the approach here is adding logic to let l3 plugin and port
forwarding plugin know each other when both sides may process the same
floatingip resource. Based on the existing revision_number feature,
if one side fail as db staleError, the api layer will retry the whole
operation for this resource, so there must be a failure on one side in
this case. This patch just adds the association logic for l3 plugin and
port forwarding plugin, also adds a event receiver for port update/delete.

Then the behavior about the port forwarding associated resources would
be:
* For fip resource, I introduce one function in that patch.
  _check_floatingip_request
So during floatingip update/delete, the function will process
fip and check by rpc callback from l3_plugin, if port forwarding plugin
also creates a port forwarding with the same fip at this moment. The
success side would be the one who update the fip_db first, the other side
would be failure after db retry.

* For port resource, during update port fixed_ip or delete port, we will
delete the associated port forwarding resources for free the
fip:external_port socket.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Change-Id: I637ebcb33b91d899a077bded5ca10097a830a847
Partial-Bug: #1491317

commit_message:
Replace os.makedirs to avoid process race

Use oslo_utils.fileutils.ensure_tree(path, mode=_DEFAULT_MODE)
to replace os.makedir.

Change-Id: Iaaec711e1d4dabb07e05a2bc2afea2b5820b82ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 17:21:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add systemd journal logging to the service config

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: I5ae4ee8b0f69a4ed9b6088f043abaa1c4b1291d8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add systemd journal logging to the service config

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: I5ae4ee8b0f69a4ed9b6088f043abaa1c4b1291d8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 16:13:34.000000000', 'message': 'Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

Change-Id: Ic5b57a650bd9f5c385ed0a0a3efd1d530a2d7e81
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: Ic5b57a650bd9f5c385ed0a0a3efd1d530a2d7e81
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Disk size is smaller than base_device_size

When disk size is none and base_device_size is larger than default_disk,
the disk size is assigned to base_device_size.
Because base_device_size is float type, when converting to interger ,
the disk size is smaller than base_device_size.
We need to assign the ceil of  base_device_size to the disk size.

Change-Id: I5c3bfc7ce4c83c39a212040601792ff1ace2fdf5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 19:06:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix server_group_members quota check

For example there are 3 instances in a server group (quota is 5).
When doing multi-creating of 3 more instances in this group
(would have 6 members), current quota checking scheme will fail to
prevent this happening, which is not expected.

This is due to the server_group_members quota check previously
only counting group members that existed as instance records in
cell databases and not accounting for build requests which are
the temporary representation of the instance in the API database
before the instance is scheduled to a cell.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If439f4486b8fe157c436c47aa408608e639a3e15
Closes-Bug: #1780373
(cherry picked from commit bbee9a26a5c64a1463bd9a9f82d735ec17c62d52)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix server_group_members quota check

For example there are 3 instances in a server group (quota is 5).
When doing multi-creating of 3 more instances in this group
(would have 6 members), current quota checking scheme will fail to
prevent this happening, which is not expected.

This is due to the server_group_members quota check previously
only counting group members that existed as instance records in
cell databases and not accounting for build requests which are
the temporary representation of the instance in the API database
before the instance is scheduled to a cell.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If439f4486b8fe157c436c47aa408608e639a3e15
Closes-Bug: #1780373
(cherry picked from commit bbee9a26a5c64a1463bd9a9f82d735ec17c62d52)

(2 comments)

nothing is jumping out at me as obviouly incorect here but its failing the migration tempest tests so im clearly missing something.
i dont think we are hitting https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586402/ but i have not checked the logs to see if its related to the multiple port binding stuff.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-07-27 13:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-07-30 10:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

Thanks for the review, Sean.  So as you pointed out on IRC, the "nova-live-migration" job failure is due to the None check for 'domain_xml'—which we removed and replaced it with 'destination_xml'; and there's no check for it.  So I'll now add the following:

    params = {}

    params['bandwidth'] = bandwidth
    params['migrate_disks'] = migrate_disks
    params['migrate_uri'] = migrate_uri

    if destination_xml:
        params['destination_xml'] = destination_xml

From the documentation[*] of 'destination_xml' (the C constant is: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_XML):

"Omitting this parameter keeps the original domain configuration."

https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_XML'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-07-30 10:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-07-30 11:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

this looks ok to me but lets wait for gate to comment back'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-30 11:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-22205 : SUCCESS in 50m 44s'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-07-30 12:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-07-30 12:31:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> this looks ok to me but lets wait for gate to comment back

Right, since 'migrate_disks' and 'migrate_uri' are also None by default, we can do the following, to be consistent:

        params = {}
        params['bandwidth'] = bandwidth

        if destination_xml:
            params['destination_xml'] = destination_xml
        if migrate_disks:
            params['migrate_disks'] = migrate_disks
        if migrate_uri:
            params['migrate_uri'] = migrate_uri"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-30 12:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 15:23:25.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Remove usage of migrateToURI2() API

The recently updated minimum required libvirt version (1.3.1; in commit
403320b -- libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Rocky") brings
in the newer libvirt migration API, migrateToURI3().  The newer API was
explicitly designed[*] to be backward compatible with the older variant.

So remove the usage of the older variant and just stick to the preferred
API, migrateToURI3().

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

[*] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=4bf62f4 --
    Extensible migration APIs

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove usage of migrateToURI{2} APIs

The recently updated minimum required libvirt version (1.3.1; in commit
403320b -- libvirt: Bump MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Rocky") brings
in the newer libvirt migration API, migrateToURI3().  The newer API was
explicitly designed[*] to be backward compatible with the older variant.

So remove the usage of the older variants:

    migrateToURI()
    migrateToURI2()

And just stick to the newer API -- migrateToURI3().

Clean up the following:

 - Add the 'migrate_disks' and 'destination_xml' paramters, and remove
   the no longer needed 'domain_xml' from the Nova migrate() method.

 - Remove or fix various unit tests to use migrateToURI3().

 - Stub nova.virt.libvirt.guest.Guest.migrate() correctly in
   nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py.

[*] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=4bf62f4 --
    Extensible migration APIs

Change-Id: Id9ee1feeadf612fa79c3d280cee3a614a74a00a7
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

subject: Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when translating before_props
messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-31 07:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-01 00:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 07:44:30.000000000', 'message': "Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when translating before_props

When translating name to id, if we don't find the resource it's
better to ignore the error and return the non-translated value
for before properties.

Change-Id: Ic25c35098cff8b68e184a336b21f2e8df70bb1ee
Story: #2003015
Task: 23103
(cherry picked from commit 8c39f3bb8b08ad37cb5411b448ef2acde6345d55)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when translating before_props

When translating name to id, if we don't find the resource it's
better to ignore the error and return the non-translated value
for before properties.

Change-Id: Ic25c35098cff8b68e184a336b21f2e8df70bb1ee
Story: #2003015
Task: 23103
(cherry picked from commit 8c39f3bb8b08ad37cb5411b448ef2acde6345d55)

subject: Delete checking a bool opt of None condition

We shouldn't remove 'None' as an option for live_migration_tunnelled. If live_migration_tunnelled is not set nova should choose a sensible default. It should use, e.g., native hypervisor encryption if possible. We should implement logic for 'None' option instead of removing it.

Also please refer to https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d7e6f20b6b25dd0a4be4078e0583f40a83b7834a/nova/conf/libvirt.py#L250"}, {'account_id': 15524, 'date': '2016-10-26 10:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Seems like live_migration_tunnelled defaults to None, so we are in fact changing the default behavior of this code.'}, {'account_id': 12299, 'date': '2016-10-26 12:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dane, by default it is False, not None - https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d7e6f20b6b25dd0a4be4078e0583f40a83b7834a/nova/conf/libvirt.py#L251'}, {'account_id': 19760, 'date': '2016-10-27 01:31:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> We shouldn't remove 'None' as an option for live_migration_tunnelled.
 > If live_migration_tunnelled is not set nova should choose a
 > sensible default. It should use, e.g., native hypervisor encryption
 > if possible. We should implement logic for 'None' option instead of
 > removing it.
 > 
 > Also please refer to https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d7e6f20b6b25dd0a4be4078e0583f40a83b7834a/nova/conf/libvirt.py#L250

 hey pawel, in my opinion, i have two ways to resolve this
 * changing   

 > Seems like live_migration_tunnelled defaults to None, so we are in
 > fact changing the default behavior of this code.

 > Dane, by default it is False, not None - https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d7e6f20b6b25dd0a4be4078e0583f40a83b7834a/nova/conf/libvirt.py#L251

 * hey pawel, live_migration_tunnelled is just a bool opt, it just true or false, and what does not set happened,he has a default value, that's the chief question. 
 * I know what's your meaning, for currently,libvirt only supportd two ways of live migration network data transport path, using libvirtd RPC tunnel or direct with hypervisor. when you design the configuration like live_migration_tunnelled, it's unnecessary to think over None opt. And when you want to design for future that libvirt will support more ways of network data transport, the configuration may be an str opt link live_migration_data_path or others, so    None may be condiered in it.

 > We shouldn't remove 'None' as an option for live_migration_tunnelled.
 > If live_migration_tunnelled is not set nova should choose a
 > sensible default. It should use, e.g., native hypervisor encryption
 > if possible. We should implement logic for 'None' option instead of
 > removing it.
 > 
 > Also please refer to https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d7e6f20b6b25dd0a4be4078e0583f40a83b7834a/nova/conf/libvirt.py#L250

 * hey pawel, live_migration_tunnelled is just a bool opt, it just true or false, and what does not set happened,he has a default value, that's the chief question. 
 * I know what's your meaning, for currently,libvirt only supportd two ways of live migration network data transport path, using libvirtd RPC tunnel or direct with hypervisor. when you design the configuration like live_migration_tunnelled, it's unnecessary to think over None opt. And when you want to design for future that libvirt will support more ways of network data transport, the configuration may be an str opt link live_migration_data_path or others, so    None may be condiered in it."}, {'account_id': 19760, 'date': '2016-10-27 08:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-27 09:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Delete checking a bool opt of None condition

Live_migration_tunnelled is a bool opt, hence, it's unnecessary to
check None in the code,live_migration_tunnelled is just true or false.
and also need to delete None condition test

Change-Id: I4a8e0d3a95062b27a36c7da40f2eda40aa8ac396
